decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, combined with cheap spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes card draw and filtering effects with cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to maintain a consistent flow of threats. Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth provide additional ways to pump up creatures for extra damage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with its tempo and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combo of cards that do not require lands to function effectively. By leveraging cards like Disrupting Shoal and Lotus Bloom, the player can quickly bring out powerful cards such as Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect. With the ability to counter opponent's spells using cards like Force of Negation and Stern Scolding, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its own win condition. The deck is focused on fast, efficient plays and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using creatures to assemble a variety of combo interactions that allow for flexibility and synergy. By utilizing cards like Birthing Ritual, Chord of Calling, and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can generate value and combo off quickly. The toolbox aspect of the deck is enhanced by cards like Sylvan Safekeeper, Orcish Bowmasters, and Endurance, allowing for disruption and protection as needed. The deck's versatility and ability to adapt to different situations make it a formidable opponent in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly pressure the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Counterspell to control the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast clock to quickly close out the game. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal significant damage. The deck includes a variety of powerful creatures such as Territorial Kavu, Scion of Draco, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with spells like Lightning Bolt for removal and Leyline of the Guildpact for additional damage. The deck also includes cards like Consign to Memory for card advantage and Leyline Binding for control. By combining these elements, the deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive, efficient play.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, you can disrupt your opponent's hand and prevent them from executing their strategy. Meanwhile, aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude can quickly close out the game. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's plans while steadily chipping away at their life total.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly to cast powerful spells like Past in Flames and Grapeshot to deal massive damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Ruby Medallion to ramp up mana production, while also having access to card draw and card selection with Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening. Ral, Monsoon Mage provides additional value by copying instants and sorceries, while Glimpse the Impossible can provide additional card advantage. The goal is to combo off quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana with rituals and mana-producing spells, then cast powerful spells like Past in Flames or Ral, Monsoon Mage to deal a large amount of damage using the Storm mechanic. It includes cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ruby Medallion to help with card selection and reducing spell costs. The deck also includes Wish for additional versatility and the ability to potentially search for specific answers. Overall, the focus is on assembling the right pieces to create a lethal storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly deploy artifacts, take advantage of low-cost spells, and synergize with Urza's Saga in order to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan. By utilizing cards like Memnite, Mox Opal, and Thoughtcast, the deck aims to build a board presence while controlling the game with counter spells like Metallic Rebuke. Urza's Saga helps to tutor for essential artifacts, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Engineered Explosives provide additional utility and disruption for the opponent. The deck focuses on tempo and efficiency to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Solitude, and Prismatic Ending. Ragavan and Phage provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer card advantage and flexibility in different situations. Utilizing a mix of lands to fix colors and provide utility, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game. Arena of Glory and Galvanic Discharge provide additional support to help secure the win.

This deck focuses on generating fast mana with rituals and mana morphose to cast powerful spells like Grapeshot and Past in Flames, enabling explosive combos. The deck aims to storm off with Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy instants and sorceries, while also utilizing Wish cards to find key pieces. The deck also includes a mix of land destruction and card draw to disrupt opponents and maintain consistency. By chaining spells together efficiently, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a flurry of burn spells and finish them off in a single turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's board while dealing consistent damage. It aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of threat by granting a damage boost to all odd CMC spells.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to summon powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths while controlling the board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck includes cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Writhing Chrysalis to provide additional control options and disruption for the opponent. With a mix of ramp and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while keeping their own board safe.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude. Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending help control the board and deal with threats, while Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage and utility. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. The deck aims to quickly outpace the opponent and maintain board control to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Amulet of Vigor and various land ramp spells in order to play Primeval Titan and search for strong lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Urza's Saga. This allows the player to generate a large amount of mana quickly and assemble a combo to win the game, either by searching for lands with Primeval Titan or by using various land-based combo pieces like Scapeshift and Lotus Field to generate an overwhelming advantage. The deck's main goal is to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful board presence and combo potential.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies combined with disruptive elements to control the battlefield and disrupt opponents' plans. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting opponent's plays. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional control elements, allowing for flexibility in dealing with various threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply quick and consistent pressure while maintaining control of the battlefield through disruption and removal.
